intro: Whitfieldia letestui, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its flowers are showy, with yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Whitfieldia letestui is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to arid and semi-arid climates.
